newsitem.title: USA: Transworld says unit buys Allied Medicare.
newsitem.headline: Transworld says unit buys Allied Medicare.

text.p: Transworld HealthCare Inc said Thursday its wholly owned subsidiary, Transworld Healthcare (UK) Ltd, has purchased British-based Allied Medicare Ltd for 36.2 million pounds, or $60.1 million.
Allied is a privately held provider of nursing and other care-giving services to home care patients.
The deal is the second acquistion for Transworld in recent weeks. The company announced May 28 it offered 167p per share in an agreed takover of Omnicare PLC.

Transworld HealthCare is a regional provider of a range of alternate site healthcare services and products. It also operates a specialized mail order pharmacy and provides medical supplies to patients.
